pageContext.claim: “I went to Iraq. I stayed in the White House for almost four months. The only time I left was to go to Iraq. I'll tell you, if you have to get cabin fever, getting cabin fever in the White House is still a good place.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump flew to Iraq on Dec. 26. He flew to Kansas City on Dec. 7 and to Texas on Jan. 10, so he was in the White House for about a month, not four months, if you don't count a trip to Camp David in that period. He did cancel a planned holiday vacation in Florida because of the government shutdown.
